items.title: Technical picks: Aadhar Housing Finance, Mahindra Lifespaces among 5 stocks that can rally up to 16% in near term
items.description: Indian equity benchmarks ended lower last week, with the Nifty 50 falling 0.7% and the Sensex declining 0.9% amid weak earnings from major financial and IT firms and ongoing global trade uncertainty. Despite the downbeat sentiment, several analysts have identified five technical picks that could deliver up to 16% returns in the near term.

items.title: IndiaMART shares in focus as Q1 net profit rises 35% YoY. Should you invest?
items.description: IndiaMART InterMESH shares: IndiaMART reported consolidated revenue from operations of ₹372 crore in Q1 FY26, reflecting a 12% year-on-year growth from ₹331 crore in the same quarter last year. This includes ₹346 crore from IndiaMART’s standalone operations, up 10% YoY, and ₹25 crore contributed by Busy Infotech.

items.title: Wipro, Bajaj Finance, GMDC, Yes Bank among 10 stocks showing RSI Trending Up on July 18
items.description: On July 18, 10 stocks from the Nifty 500 pack appeared in the RSI Trending Up scan, according to the stockedge.com data. It is an uptrend signal if the RSI value has crossed above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" means that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting strengthening momentum in the price of the stock. This can indicate potential upward movement and may be used by traders to identify buying opportunities.

items.title: Sensex jumps over 300 pts, Nifty tops 25,000 as strong Q1 earnings lift market sentiment
items.description: Indian equity indices rebounded on Monday, fueled by strong Q1 earnings from HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, and Reliance Industries, offsetting concerns about global trade. The Sensex climbed 284 points, while the Nifty50 rose 77 points. Experts are closely watching US-India trade talks, as a favorable deal could further boost market sentiment.

items.title: Jane Street gets Sebi nod to resume trading in Indian markets after escrow deposit: Report
items.description: Jane Street, a U.S. trading firm, is back in Indian markets. This follows a Sebi directive. The firm deposited Rs 4,844 crore in an escrow account. Sebi had banned Jane Street earlier. The ban was due to alleged market manipulation. The firm's return involves close monitoring by exchanges. Sebi's investigation revealed substantial profits by Jane Street.

items.title: Stocks to buy today: ONGC, HDFC AMC among top 7 trading ideas for 21 July 2025
items.description: The Indian market is expected to open lower on Monday amid weak global cues. Nifty futures closed at 25,026, down 0.59%, while India VIX edged up. Options data suggests a broad range of 24,500–25,500, with profit-taking pressure visible. Analysts recommend select stock picks and F&O strategies as Nifty struggles to reclaim the 25,000 mark.

items.title: RBL Bank shares slide 3% after Q1 net profit declines 46% YoY. Should you buy?
items.description: RBL Bank's shares are under scrutiny following a 46% YoY drop in net profit for Q1FY26, reaching ₹200.33 crore due to decreased interest income and increased operating expenses. NII fell by 13% YoY to ₹1,481 crore, with NIM at 4.50%. Despite a slight rise in GNPA to 2.78%, NNPA improved to 0.45%.

items.title: Sona Comstar shares in focus after China EV JV worth $20 million
items.description: Sona Comstar has signed a $20 million JV deal with China’s Jinnaite Machinery to manufacture driveline systems for EVs and non-EVs. Backed by JNT’s patented tech and strong OEM clientele, the venture aims to tap growth in China and global markets. With a robust order book, operations are expected to begin in H2 FY26.

items.title: HDFC Bank shares gain 2% on 12% YoY profit jump. Is it time to buy?
items.description: HDFC Bank's Q1FY26 standalone net profit rose 12% YoY to Rs 18,155 crore. The bank announced its first-ever 1:1 bonus issue and a special interim dividend of Rs 5 per share. Antique maintains a 'Buy' rating with a target price of Rs 2,270, citing an improved growth outlook and potential RoA expansion.

items.title: 7 Nifty500 stocks with highest dividend yields. Do you own any?
items.description: If you're looking for steady income from your investments, dividend-paying stocks can be a good option. Dividend yield shows how much a company pays out in dividends each year compared to its stock price. As per Trendlyne data, these 7 stocks from the Nifty500 index gave dividend yields of up to 9% in the last 12 months. Here's the list:

items.title: Yes Bank shares in focus after Q1 PAT zooms 59% YoY
items.description: Yes Bank reported a 59% YoY jump in Q1FY26 net profit to Rs 801 crore, driven by higher non-interest income and improved NII. Asset quality remained stable, while NIM rose to 2.5%. Technical indicators suggest a potential trend reversal, with analysts projecting a near-term upside towards Rs 21.50–23.00, backed by bullish chart patterns and strong support levels.

items.title: GMDC, PVR Inox among 6 stocks that rose above VWAP on July 18
items.description: On July 18, the closing prices of six stocks from the Nifty 500 pack rallied in the range of 1-3% relative to their VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price), and a shift above the VWAP suggests a potential bullish trend, according to Stockedge.com's technical scan data.When the closing price rises above the VWAP, it signifies that the closing price is higher than the average price at which it was traded throughout the day, with the average being weighted by trading volume. This occurrence is often interpreted as a potential bullish signal by traders and investors. Potentially indicating positive sentiment in the market.

items.title: ICICI Bank shares surge 2% after Q1 profit rises 15% YoY to Rs 12,768 crore. Should you buy, sell, or hold?
items.description: ICICI Bank shares: ICICI Bank's shares experienced a surge following the announcement of a 15.5% YoY increase in net profit for the June quarter, reaching Rs 12,768 crore. While NII saw a 10.6% rise, NIM experienced a slight dip.

items.title: Man Industries, Cupid, ITC Hotels among 6 stocks with White Marubozu Pattern on July 18
items.description: On July 18, in the NSE list of stocks with a market cap of Rs 1,000 crore, six stocks came to the bullish scanner of "White Marubozu", according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis. It occurs when the opening price is the lowest for a given period, and the closing price is the highest.Represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow, it indicates strong buying pressure throughout the session. Traders interpret it as a signal that buyers were in control from the opening to the closing, often using such patterns for informed decisions about future price movements in financial markets.

items.title: Cupid, NACL Industries among 5 smallcap stocks witness 5-year swing high breakout
items.description: In the NSE smallcap pack, we have collated a list of five stocks that witnessed a 5-year swing high at the close on July 18, suggesting bullishness in counters, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. Take a look.A 5-year swing high represents the highest price a stock has reached within a five-year timeframe. This level acts as a significant resistance point where the price has historically struggled to go beyond. This occurrence may be seen as a bullish sign, indicating the potential for further upward movement in the stock. However, it's worth noting that this is different from a 5-year breakout, which occurs when a stock's price surpasses a key resistance level that has held for five years.

items.title: Cupid shares rally 64% in a week, hit new all-time high of Rs 152. Should you book profits?
items.description: Cupid Limited shares surged, reaching an all-time high. This surge follows strong technical momentum and increased trading volumes. Aditya Kumar Halwasiya, Chairman, featured in a prestigious list. Analysts suggest booking profits due to overbought conditions. SBI Securities sees potential for further gains. Choice Broking advises caution and profit-taking. Investors should monitor for retracements and consider staggered accumulation.

items.title: Beyond 1:1 bonus issue, why HDFC Bank shares remain top pick after Q1 results
items.description: HDFC Bank's first bonus issue attracts investors. Brokerages view the bank's fundamentals as strong. They expect stronger growth in the second half of FY26. This growth will be aided by loan demand and easing regulations. The bank's Q1 results show a profit increase. Loan growth is expected to improve. Target prices have been raised across the board.

items.title: Investor sentiment cautious amid Japan leadership doubts
items.description: Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s ruling coalition suffered a significant political setback by losing control of the upper house in Sunday’s election. Despite the loss, Ishiba has expressed his intention to stay on as party leader, citing the urgency of ongoing tariff negotiations with the United States. While markets were closed for a holiday on Monday, the yen strengthened and Nikkei futures rose slightly, suggesting the election outcome was already priced in by investors. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Mastek shares rally 13% after Q1 net profit surges 29% YoY
items.description: Mastek's shares surged by 13.08% following a robust Q1FY26 financial report, showcasing a 28.7% increase in net profit. Trading above all key Simple Moving Averages, the company's strengths, including attractive valuation and consistent profit growth, outweigh its weaknesses. With low debt and zero promoter pledge, Mastek's financial stability boosts investor confidence.

items.title: Newgen Software shares slide over 16% in three days after weak Q1 earnings
items.description: Newgen Software's share price has slumped over 16% in three sessions after weak Q1FY26 earnings. The company reported flat YoY growth in profit and revenue, with sequential declines across key geographies and segments. Margins also narrowed due to higher costs, triggering bearish investor sentiment.

items.title: Axis Bank, LTIMindtree among 7 F&O stocks that saw a high increase in futures open interest
items.description: As of July 18, there was a notable surge in futures open interest for seven stocks in the NSE F&O pack, contributing to a total increase in open interest of over 7% as compared to the previous trade. A significant uptick in futures open interest signifies a substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts in a specific security. This uptrend reflects an increasing number of participants either initiating new positions or expanding the size of their existing positions within the futures market.

items.title: Waaree Renewable Technologies shares slide 6% amid US trade petition on Indian solar panel imports
items.description: Waaree Renewable Technologies' shares plunged 6.2% following a U.S. petition seeking tariffs on solar panel imports from India, Indonesia, and Laos. The petition alleges dumping and unfair subsidies, impacting Indian manufacturers. Despite this, Waaree reported a strong Q1 with a 205% jump in net profit to Rs 86.44 crore and a doubling of revenue. The U.S.

items.title: Rising Costs, Shrinking Choices: The consumer impact of tariffs
items.description: With less than 22 weeks to go before Christmas, U.S. retailers usually finalise holiday orders and pricing. But this year, they're caught in a maze of changing tariffs and trade policies, delaying key decisions. (Source: AP)

items.title: Anthem Biosciences shares rally 3% after healthy listing. Should you buy now?
items.description: Anthem Biosciences share price: Anthem’s IPO did not include a fresh issue, with all proceeds going to existing shareholders. Prior to the IPO opening, anchor investors had already invested Rs 1,016 crore.

items.title: China’s Balancing Act: Stability vs stimulus
items.description: China has decided to keep its benchmark lending rates unchanged, following slightly better-than-expected second-quarter economic data. The decision was widely anticipated and indicates cautious optimism from policymakers. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Union Bank shares slip 4% after Q1 profit rises 12% YoY but NII declines
items.description: Union Bank shares: Total income increased to Rs 31,791 crore in the June quarter, up from Rs 30,874 crore in the same period last year. However, net interest income (NII) fell 3.2% year-on-year to Rs 9,112.6 crore, compared to Rs 9,412 crore previously.

items.title: Ircon International shares jump over 4% on bagging multiple contracts
items.description: Ircon International's shares saw a rise following the acquisition of contracts valued at Rs 755.78 crore. A joint venture with RVNL secured a project, with Ircon's share at Rs 529.04 crore. MMRDA awarded Ircon contracts for Mumbai Metro Lines 5 and 6. The company's Q4 net profit saw a slight decline.

items.title: Explained: Why Reliance Industries shares fell 3% after reporting highest-ever profit
items.description: Reliance Industries shares: Jefferies offered a candid assessment, noting that consolidated EBITDA came in 3% below its estimates, with the O2C and Retail segments missing expectations by 5% and 4%, respectively. Despite this, the global brokerage retained its Buy rating with a target price of ₹1,726.

items.title: MRPL shares slide 7% after co slips to loss in Q1 on margin, revenue hit
items.description: MRPL reported a net loss of Rs 271 crore in Q1FY26, reversing from a profit last year. Revenue and refining margins declined sharply. The company’s Gross Refining Margin (GRM), a key indicator of profitability in the refining business, dropped to $3.88 per barrel from $4.70 per barrel year-on-year, highlighting the pressure on MRPL’s core operations.

items.title: Axis Bank shares slip 2% after Q1 profit hit linked to RBI-driven bad loan spike
items.description: Axis Bank shares faced a dip of 2.4% after Q1FY26 results. The bank's net profit fell 4% to Rs 5,806 crore. This was due to a sharp rise in provisions for bad loans. The Reserve Bank of India's intervention led to this increase. RBI flagged Axis Bank's lenient policies on stressed loans. This prompted corrective action, impacting the bank's profitability.

items.title: BSE shares rally 3% after Jane Street said to have received clearance to resume trading in India
items.description: BSE shares: According to a report, Jane Street has received official confirmation from SEBI that the restriction on its access to Indian securities markets has been lifted.

items.title: Stock picks of the week: 4 stocks with consistent score improvement and return potential of more than 19% in 1 year
items.description: As the broader indices, the Nifty and Sensex tell us what is happening in the market. But there are times when it is best to ignore them. Why? Because they can move up and down because of just one or two stocks. And they may have nothing to do with either the stock you have in your portfolio or the stock you are planning to buy. We are in those times. So, ignore what the Nifty and Sensex are doing and focus on what companies are saying and doing about their businesses. Our selected stocks for today depict a strong upward trajectory in their overall average score which is based on five key pillars: Earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum. This implies that there has been a significant improvement in their market outlook in the given time frame.

items.title: Kalpataru pre-sales jump 41% to Rs 4,531 cr in FY25 on better housing demand
items.description: Kalpataru Ltd experienced a robust 41% surge in pre-sales, reaching Rs 4,531 crore, fueled by strong residential demand. The company launched seven new projects spanning 6.5 million sq ft and signed redevelopment agreements worth Rs 2,100 crore.

items.title: Engineers India, NBCC among 8 PSU stocks where both FIIs and MF hiked stake in Q1. Do you own any?
items.description: Public sector stocks have taken centre stage in FY26’s market rally. The BSE PSU Index has surged 8.76%, outpacing the Sensex’s 5.61% gain. And this outperformance isn’t just driven by a handful of names—39 out of 63 PSU stocks have gained over 10% so far this financial year.To understand where the smart money is flowing, we analysed June 2025 shareholding data for 53 listed PSU companies, focusing on where both Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) and mutual funds have increased stakes. Such dual institutional interest is uncommon—and typically seen as a strong vote of confidence.We found 8 PSU stocks where both FIIs and domestic mutual funds have raised their holdings. Notably, 7 of these have already delivered strong stock price returns, with one rising 65% in under four months. (Source: ACE Equity)

items.title: Signature Global to launch homes worth Rs 6k cr in Gurugram in Jul-Sep: Chairman
items.description: Signature Global, a leading realty firm, plans to launch homes worth Rs 6,000 crore in Gurugram this quarter, targeting both end-users and investors. Despite a 15% dip in pre-sales during the June quarter, the company remains confident in achieving its Rs 12,500 crore sales target for the fiscal year.

items.title: FIIs pull out $9.2 billion from Indian equities in 2025, but bet big on telecom and financials
items.description: Foreign investors have pulled out $9.2 billion from Indian equities in 2025 so far, with major outflows from IT and FMCG. However, they’ve bet big on telecom and financials, pumping in over Rs 41,000 crore—indicating confidence in India’s long-term growth sectors.

items.title: Aswath Damodaran gives 4 reasons why companies should think twice before parking cash in Bitcoin
items.description: Valuation expert Aswath Damodaran calls corporate Bitcoin holdings a risky move. He argues Bitcoin fails the purpose of cash reserves, distracts from core business, and invites governance risks. He outlines rare exceptions but urges caution and transparency.

items.title: Bajaj Consumer board to meet on July 24 to consider share buyback, stock rallies 5%
items.description: Bajaj Consumer Care shares rose sharply after the company announced a board meeting on July 24 to consider a share buyback proposal. This would be the company’s third buyback since 2022. The trading window remains closed until post Q1FY26 results.

items.title: Stocks to Buy | Mixed Trends, Steady Outlook – Pankaj Pandey analyses market pulse
items.description: Pankaj Pandey, in an interview with ET Now, said that HDFC Bank delivered a steady quarter despite some near-term margin pressure. The bank is now focusing more on accelerating credit momentum rather than just balance sheet consolidation. With ROAs at around 1.8%, he maintains a Buy rating on the stock and retains a target price of Rs 2200.On Reliance, Pankaj Pandey described the performance as a mixed bag. He noted positive momentum in Jio’s subscriber additions, which is expected to boost data usage. The street is building in a 10% tariff hike, which will be a key trigger. On the retail front, results were slightly below expectations.Pankaj Pandey remarked that while heavyweights have reported mostly stable earnings, the broader market still lacks a decisive trigger. Banking and IT, which make up half of the Nifty, remain flat, suggesting the current consolidation phase could continue for some more time.

items.title: Dolly Khanna raises stake in multibagger smallcap stock to 3.33% in Q1. Do you own it?
items.description: Dolly Khanna increased her stake in multibagger Mangalore Chemicals to 3.33% in Q1FY26. The stock has rallied 148% in a year. She also picked up stakes in Coffee Day Enterprises and Prakash Industries, as per latest shareholding disclosures for the June 2025 quarter.

items.title: BEML approves first-ever 1:2 stock split in board meeting today. Check all details
items.description: Each existing equity share with a face value of Rs 10 will be split into two fully paid-up shares of Rs 5 each, as per the announcement. The proposal is subject to shareholder approval, after which the company will announce the record date.

items.title: Navigating Valuations: George Thomas breaks down midcaps, banks and more
items.description: George Thomas, in an interview with ET Now, said that despite a somewhat muted earnings season, the market has delivered a 6% gain over the past six months. Revenue growth for the BSE 500 in the March quarter stood at around 6–7%, with margins remaining stable. However, he adds that elevated valuations limited the scope for generating strong returns during this period.

items.title: Traders can go bust even when they know the outcome; Zerodha cofounder Nithin Kamath explains how
items.description: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath highlighted an ElmWealth experiment revealing that many finance students lost money trading, despite predicting market direction correctly 51.5% of the time. The core issue wasn't prediction accuracy, but poor position sizing and excessive leverage. Experienced traders, focusing on risk management and bet sizing, achieved significantly better returns.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Antique maintains Hold call on JSW Steel; Morgan Stanley maintains Outperform rating on RIL
items.description: Morgan Stanley is still optimistic about Reliance Industries growth. Antique Stock Broking maintains a 'Hold' rating for JSW Steel. Domestic steel demand is expected to remain strong. Antique reaffirms a 'Buy' rating on HDFC Bank. Improved growth and margin levers drive this preference. The bank's results were largely in line with expectations. Lower operating expenses are anticipated with branch additions.

items.title: As volatility rears its head again, manage and win over it: 11 basic principles of investing in stocks that will help you do it
items.description: It is the small things, if taken care of diligently, that will make a big difference to the returns investors make on the market. Now, because the market is in an unpredictable mood, be more careful while investing. However, the fact is that the need to be careful is greater when the market is controlled by bulls, as the probability of making mistakes is higher. For now, these 11 investing principles may  help you in a volatile market. Even if you don’t follow all of them, they will help you make wise investing decisions.

items.title: F&O Radar| Deploy Bear Put Spread in Nifty to play short-term market weakness
items.description: The Nifty index faced a decline, dropping below its 40-day EMA. Sustained selling pressure is evident. Experts suggest a bearish outlook for the near term. They recommend traders consider a Bear Put Spread strategy. This involves buying and selling put options with different strike prices. The aim is to capitalize on anticipated market weakness.

items.title: Top Nifty50 stocks analysts suggest buying in this volatile week
items.description: Stock Reports Plus, powered by Refinitiv, is a comprehensive research report that evaluates five key components of 4,000+ listed stocks – earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum – to generate standardized scores. The simple average of the above-mentioned five component ratings is normally distributed to reach an average score.
